source_sentence: 蓮華部多利心菩薩念誦法
translation: Method of Recitation of the Bodhisattva Doriṣṭhila of the Lotus School

source_sentence: 南天竺三藏跋折羅菩提集撰摳要念誦門是中意欲偏成多利心菩薩亦通一切諸部若餘部用時必須就明法者邊諮決刪定明呪印諸餘次第更勿增減此法門與諸經法門及瑜伽門相會紐成為彼初心求解脫者得階地位故修緝成就彼行修此門者先應入大三昧耶壇受菩薩戒行菩薩行起大悲意捨身命財饒益有情專心希仰佛菩提身不著貪恚懃心勇猛攝心不亂慈悲喜捨恒無暫息心常發願無邊眾生悉令度於彼岸行此法者自身內外清淨極令嚴潔於諸長宿和上闍梨等處常應尊重心無謟曲語言誠實勿違信命隨分行施莫貪著財施心無間於四威儀莫令缺斷常修梵行勿思色欲放逸恣情及營諸務如是中間剎那剎那時分澄念諦覩諸行皆悉無常略而言之一切諸法猶如鏡像既知是已當須披精進鎧壞煩惱軍持祕明呪劒破盡[梐-比+(髓-骨)]網出生死妄海至菩提場坐金剛座決定自心勿令退轉如是作意之人方應修習此大乘戒藏中最勝法門是故我次第而說欲念誦者先淨於地淨之法量取其地或四肘八肘十一肘十六肘等於是量中隨力取之堀深至膝或深一肘擇去虫蟻及諸瓦礫髮骨灰炭糠粃棘刺本根之屬諸穢惡等物已填滿淨土堅實令平等訖當於其上修妙精舍淨塗其室先定方面若求除災法者其室應當開南門面向北坐坐時當交兩脚脛坐若作求增益法者當開西門面向東結跏趺坐若作瞋怒法者當開北門面向南坐作蹲踞二足左押右若作朋友相親法者當開東門面向西並兩脚竪開二膝而坐此名造精舍及求事意呪師坐起結印作法略以說訖若先有淨室或於露地或在山石等上但作其壇亦得隨所求事一依法作之悉得隨願其室先以有塗飾之處即取後呪呪之然後方用若欲復淨其地掃令清淨初掃地時當誦是呪呪曰。
translation: When using the other schools, one must consult the side of those who understand the teaching, decide on the deletion of the scriptures, the teaching and the yoga teaching, and follow the order of the other schools without adding or subtracting anything. This teaching, together with the teachings of the scriptures and the yoga teaching, will help those who first seek liberation to attain a higher level of attainment.

source_sentence: 唵訶囉訶囉囉儒揭囉訶囉拏耶莎訶
translation: "Om hara hara hara hara rugalla hara naya sahā.

source_sentence: 誦是三遍而掃掃已除上之時復誦後呪曰。
translation: After reciting this spell three times and sweeping it off, he then recites the following spell.

source_sentence: 唵(一)稅提摩訶稅提(二)戌達儞(二)莎訶誦呪訖已除其上用牛糞塗壇時呪曰。
translation: Om (1) ṛddhi, mahātaḍhi (2) śūdanī (2) sahā when he has finished reciting the spell and has removed it by rubbing cow dung on the altar, he says.

source_sentence: 唵(一)羯囉隸(二)摩訶羯囉隷(二)莎訶誦是呪用為塗壇地洗供養器及香水器等呪曰。
translation: Om (1) Kālālī (2) Mahākālī (2) Śākala (2) Śākha recites this spell for coating the altar floor with cow-dung to wash the offering vessels and perfume vessels, etc.

source_sentence: 那謨悉底哩那(一)墜肥迦南薩婆怛他揭多南(二)唵(三)尾囉耳尾囉耳(四)摩訶跋折哩薩多薩多(五)薩囉帝薩囉帝多羅曳多羅曳(六)毗陀摩儞(七)三畔闍儞(八)多囉摩底(十)悉陀(九)揭哩(引)帝哩焰(十一)莎訶誦是呪三遍已洗諸供具所以誦是呪者為欲淨除犯三昧耶法一切觸穢之過咎也若食器及香花供養之物未供養中間總集置一淨處誦是明呪結印防護呪曰。
translation: 那謨悉底哩那(一)墜肥迦南薩婆怛他揭多南(二)唵(三)尾囉耳尾囉耳(四)摩訶跋折哩薩多薩多(五)薩囉帝薩囉帝多羅曳多羅曳(六)毗陀摩儞(七)三畔闍儞(八)多囉摩底(十)悉陀(九)揭哩(引)帝哩焰(十一)莎訶誦是呪三遍已洗諸供具所以誦是呪者為欲淨除犯三昧耶法一切觸穢之過咎也若食器及香花供養之物未供養中間總集置一淨處誦是明呪結印防護呪曰。

source_sentence: 唵(一)始佉哩(二)跋折哩(三)啼(四)結印以右手中指已下三指握大母指為拳直竪其頭指即成以此印印其物上右轉揮之以為防護一切香華燈塗及飲食等訖作法人然後往於浴處作是法時或自作或令弟子作之俱得若欲結印之時先應結三三昧耶印已然後方得結於諸印三昧相者第一佛三昧耶印以二手並側申相著如常掬物以頭指頭附於中指上文次以大母指頭附於頭指下文即成是印呪曰。
translation: Om (1) Śikhāri (2) Vātsī (3) Ārya (4) Binding the Seals Take the middle and lower three fingers of your right hand, make a fist with your middle finger, and straighten your head finger to form this seal, turn it to the right and wave it over the object to protect it from all the flowers, incense, lamps, food and drink, etc. When the practitioner then goes to the bathing place to perform the ritual, either he makes it himself or has his disciples make it.

source_sentence: 唵(一)怛他揭覩(二)納婆皤耶(三)莎訶誦此呪以印舉安頂上當作是想是印即是佛身。
translation: Om (1) tathāgata (2) nava-vargata (3) sahā recite this dhāraṇī and raise it to the top of the head as a sign, thinking that this sign is the Buddha's body.

source_sentence: 次說蓮花三昧耶印。
translation: Next, he teaches the lotus flower samaya mudrā.

source_sentence: 以二手腕相著竪兩手散開十指以二大母指並相著二小指亦然即成以印舉安頂上如近右相當作是想此印即是聖觀自在菩薩即說呪曰。
translation: He takes his two palms together and raises them, spreads his ten fingers apart, puts his two big fingers together, and puts his two little fingers together, and likewise forms the seal.

source_sentence: 唵(一)鉢頭牟(二)納婆皤耶(三)莎訶次說金剛三昧耶印。
translation: "Om (1) padma (2) nava-vātya (3) sahā, then he says the vajrasamaya mudrā.

source_sentence: 以二手皆右押左即右小指叉於左大母指右大母指叉於左小指即成呪曰。
translation: He puts his right hand on his left, meaning that he crosses his right little finger over his left big toe, and his right big toe crosses his left little finger, which forms the mantra.

source_sentence: 唵(一)跋折嚧(二)納婆皤耶(三)莎訶以印舉安頂上近左相已想為金剛作是三三昧耶印已然後方可結於一切諸印當遵三部呪王秘藏當依是法行用更說其要凡修行人於晨朝初起之時未有所為將欲出者當作是法然後出入應先結印念明呪已然後方行之是明呪曰。
translation: After he has made these three samaya mudrās, he can then make all the mudrās. He must follow the three part secret store of the Dhāraṇī king and practice in accordance with this teaching.

source_sentence: 那牟囉怛那怛羅耶夜(一)那謨始旃荼跋折囉波拏曳(二)摩訶藥叉栖那波多曳(三)那牟跋折囉俱嚧陀耶(四)鄧瑟覩嚧迦吒倍異囉皤耶(五)怛地他(六)唵(七)阿蜜哩多軍荼里(八)佉佉(九)佉醯佉醯(十)底瑟佗底瑟侘(十一)畔陀畔陀(十二)訶那訶那(十三)揭闍揭闍(十四)毗悉怖吒耶毗悉怖吒耶(十五)薩婆毗近那毗那夜迦摩訶伽那跋底(十六)是比單多羯羅那(十七)吽泮(十八)莎訶誦此呪以兩手各用大母指捻小指甲上申餘三指即交兩臂右押左各附膊上即成心中應作想兩脚如八字立脹其腮咬右邊脣作其瞋怒狀誦呪七遍此名辟魔若欲縛諸作障礙鬼神等者即舉兩手三指即縛諸障縛諸障時應云畔陀畔陀作此法已然後出房若持誦作法者澡浴時當取淨土以火燒之令熟以為細末末已盛一器中即成用印誦呪而更淨之未淨勿用是印相者以二手頭指已下三指右押左向外相叉並合竪二頭指側竪二大母指即是呪曰。
translation: 那牟囉怛那怛羅耶夜(一)那謨始旃荼跋折囉波拏曳(二)摩訶藥叉栖那波多曳(三)那牟跋折囉俱嚧陀耶(四)鄧瑟覩嚧迦吒倍異囉皤耶(五)怛地他(六)唵(七)阿蜜哩多軍荼里(八)佉佉(九)佉醯佉醯(十)底瑟佗底瑟侘(十一)畔陀畔陀(十二)訶那訶那(十三)揭闍揭闍(十四)毗悉怖吒耶毗悉怖吒耶(十五)薩婆毗近那毗那夜迦摩訶伽那跋底(十六)是比單多羯羅那(十七)吽泮(十八)莎訶誦此呪以兩手各用大母指捻小指甲上申餘三指即交兩臂右押左各附膊上即成心中應作想兩脚如八字立脹其腮咬右邊脣作其瞋怒狀誦呪七遍此名辟魔若欲縛諸作障礙鬼神等者即舉兩手三指即縛諸障縛諸障時應云畔陀畔陀作此法已然後出房若持誦作法者澡浴時當取淨土以火燒之令熟以為細末末已盛一器中即成用印誦呪而更淨之未淨勿用是印相者以二手頭指已下三指右押左向外相叉並合竪二頭指側竪二大母指即是呪曰。

source_sentence: 唵(一)儞佉那(二)皤蘇第(三)莎訶誦此呪已三遍以印觸其土[利-禾+垂]上始名為淨方可受用持法人若往諸處先以印護身是印以二手二小指二無名指右押左向內相叉二中指直竪頭相著二頭指附二中指上文背相去一分並竪二大母指捻其中文即呪曰。
translation: After reciting this dhāraṇī three times, he touches the [li-ho+tri] surface of the land with his seal before it's called pure. If he goes anywhere, he first protects himself with this seal.

source_sentence: 唵(一)跋折羅(二)祇儞鉢羅捻波多耶(三)莎訶用此印印於五處頭二肩上心及喉是名五處方可往也此名護身法若往廁時先應彈指三度驚覺然後上之彈指呪曰。
translation: Om (1) vajra (2) jīnapura twisted bodhisattva (3) sahā With this seal, you can seal the five places, head, shoulders, heart, and throat, which are called the five places before you can go.

source_sentence: 唵(一)枳哩枳哩(二)枳羅勞枳羅(三)吽泮一誦一彈指乃至三遍始可往於廁上若洗淨時心中存念想前軍荼利呪及形然後洗手訖已即嗽口嗽口畢已以印口右手中指無名指屈入於掌中大母指頭指小指直申承水用三度嗽之呪曰。
translation: Om (1) Kili Kili (2) Kila Kila (3) Un paan One recitation, one flick of the fingers, and up to three times before going to the toilet If you're mindful of the previous kuṇḍalin spell and its shape while washing, then you should wash your mouth after washing your hands After washing, you should wash your mouth After washing, you should bend the middle finger and ring finger of your right hand into your palm, bend the big toe, head finger, and little finger, and straighten them to bear the water three times.

source_sentence: 唵(一)柱柱禮(二)俱嚧俱嚧(三)莎訶用是印呪嗽已復作淨除身中隱形作障鬼神等印呪二手各為拳即舒二頭指以右頭指於左拳中握之左頭指於右亦然呪曰。
translation: After coughing with this mantra, he then purifies his body by removing the invisible forms in his body, creating hindrances and spirits, etc. He makes a fist with each hand, extends his two fingers, puts his right finger in his left fist, and holds his left finger to his right.

source_sentence: 唵(一)訶那訶那(二)阿蜜哩帝(三)吽泮誦呪三遍以印從頭徐徐摩之向下三度為之能令身中一切魔障悉皆消滅想知諸魔等出已復作縛諸魔印其印是大怒金剛印也當以左手向外托之即以右手翻背於左手背上以八指各相叉已即左戾之翻向心上總為拳已並竪二大母指已當心安之復以右肘內於左肘中向外出之以印安頭上已即開其印徐徐下即是呪曰。
translation: Om (1) Haṇa Haṇa (2) Amṛti (3) Un paan Recite the dhāraṇī three times, then slowly move the seal from the head down three times.

source_sentence: 唵(一)枳哩枳哩(二)毗摩勞達羅(三)鉢羅訖哩帝(四)摩訶俱嚧陀(五)毗社耶(六)儞訖[口*闌]多(七)吽吽(八)泮(九)盤陀盤陀莎訶(十)以是印呪力故能令一切魔等被縛復想自身披金剛甲使令魔宮震動不安悉來歸降[利-禾+垂]又以淨土作其三分分土之時復更作印呪以右手大母指捻小指頭已即安此印於右腰側左手亦作此印以水灑於土上呪曰。
translation: Om (1) Kelikila (2) Vimalaudhara (3) Prākṛti (4) Mahākruta (5) Viśaya (6) Śikhin (7) Unh (8) Pan (9) Panda (10) Because of the power of this dhāraṇī, it will cause all Māra to be bound, and when he conceives of himself wearing the vajra armor, it will cause the Māra palace to be shaken and disturbed as they all come to surrender.

source_sentence: 唵(一)阿蜜哩啼(二)吽泮
translation: "Om (1) Amṛtri-āl (2) Un pam.

source_sentence: 誦此呪三遍用灑之於後用土又作淨水法以左手大母指屈入掌已即屈中指無名指押大母指上次屈頭指小指如鈎其二指頭並於中指無名指中節背右手以大母指捻小指頭餘三指直申以手叉腰屈左臂手向外即是呪曰。
translation: After reciting this dhāraṇī three times and sprinkling it with earth, he performs the ritual of purifying water by bending the middle finger and ring finger into the palm of his hand, then bending the middle finger and ring finger, he presses the middle finger and ring finger into the last bend and bends the little finger like a hook.

source_sentence: 那牟跋折囉吽(一)訶那度那(二)摩他尾時奉娑瑜瑳囉耶吽泮誦此呪七遍作前印入於水中若河若海若池等中皆作是印若用呪貯水時但用是印以觸之然後浴也入於水已即舉右手不放其以揮下方及四方上方以為結界揮印之時當誦此呪呪曰。
translation: Namo bajyarā un (a) Haṇadunā (b) Mātavī (c) Bong Suyog-elaya Un paan recite this mantra seven times, making a frontal sign to enter water, such as a river, an ocean, a pond, etc. If you use a mantra to store water, just touch it with this sign and then bathe it.

source_sentence: 唵(一)商羯哩(二)三昧曳(三)莎訶誦是呪三遍用揮結界已即成界畔又若用淨土之時應以右手大母指捻小指頭餘三指直申以水灑於土上及澡豆等上用之呪曰。
translation: Om (1) Śaṃkali (2) Samādhi (3) Śākha recite this spell three times, swinging it across the boundary to form a boundary.

source_sentence: 唵(一)枳哩枳哩(二)跋折囉(三)吽泮又復淨水印者以二手頭指以下三指向內相叉以二頭指屈頭相拄稍圓之勿方二大指並竪呪曰。
translation: Om (a) hari hari (b) vajra (c) unpaṇḍala (d) pam (e) and again, for the pure water seal, use the second hand to fold the three fingers below the head inward, bend the two head fingers to lean against each other in a slightly circular way, and then raise the two large fingers together.

source_sentence: 唵(一)訶那跋折囉(二)跋折哩拏訶誦上呪三遍以內於水中撓之能令水中一切魚龍及諸毒虫等并諸障等不能為害。
translation: Om (1) Haṇabhadra (2) Vajrīnāha recites the above dhāraṇī three times and bends it in the water, causing all the fish, dragons, venomous insects, and other hindrances in the water to become harmless.

source_sentence: 又若用澡豆等欲揩摩身體之時應以右手中指無名指屈雙入掌以其大指捻其二指甲上頭指小指直申所用澡豆灰土等并安掌內已先用摩頭若洗上分時呪曰。
translation: If you want to moisten your body with soap and so forth, you should use the middle finger and ring finger of your right hand to bend both into your palm, twist the two fingernails, place the top finger and little finger straight up, and then place the soap and ash inside your palm.

source_sentence: 唵(一)阿蜜哩帝(二)吽泮
translation: "Om (1) Amṛti (2) Un pam.

source_sentence: 次洗身下分時呪曰。
translation: The next dhāraṇī for washing the body is as follows.

source_sentence: 唵(一)步(二)什皤囉(三)吽
translation: Om (1) Bu (2) Shibul (3) Un

source_sentence: 次若洗身下分已復用前嗽口呪印洗嗽已方觸頭等及洗浴了時洗手嗽口等亦同作如是浴已便用軍荼利甲以被於身是法當以二手中指無名指屈入掌中即以大指各捻其二指甲上以二手中指無名指背中節相著二頭指二小指頭拄即成呪曰。
translation: After washing his body and lowering his mouth, he then uses the preceding sign for washing his mouth, washing his hands and washing his mouth after touching his head, etc. He then washes his hands and washes his mouth after bathing in the same way.

source_sentence: 唵(一)肥摩羅跛哩(二)皤[口*栗]多(三)跋折哩(四)吽誦是呪著衣并著瓔珞頭冠鐶釧及諸嚴身之具皆同用前呪正澡浴著衣結護於其中間不應起嗔及邪憶念諸一切穢惡及不吉祥等物皆不應視若澡浴了已趣精舍時不可跣足而往心中作想有八葉蓮花承其脚足自身與本天形同類想左右皆備天龍八部神王圍繞侍從想復觀本神在己面前儼然而住三界之中一切持誦之人欲出行時無論遠近路中有生草及諸畜生等不應乘騎諸供養等物及塔影尊像等影及師僧父母等影皆不應踏至精舍前復更洗嗽口而入精舍初開戶時作一吽聲而入入已作禮禮時作如是心三世諸佛菩薩一切法王常住無變但凡夫宍眼不親覩見作是想已當除三癡發修三福五體投地殷重而禮禮拜之時心口相應作如是言我今歸命一切諸佛及菩薩作是言禮已便雙膝而跪合掌至心懺悔一切過咎自作教他見聞道喜如是等諸惡悉皆懺悔懺悔了復應隨喜一切功德廣發大願誓修諸善不害於物作是法已即便右膝著地依前金剛三昧印誦是呪呪曰。

translation: Namo samantabhadra (1) svātathāyau (2) nakṣatra (3) svabhārahe [mu*han] (4) gaganāgama (5) svāhā Recite this incantation to enter into various samādhis and follow the mind's contemplations, which are all accomplished according to the Buddha's sincere words and should not be doubted.

translation: After reciting this incantation to purify his body, he then said, "For countless eons, he has been caught up in the flow of birth and death, drowning in the water of affliction, not meeting a good friend, following his heart, not being able to escape, and not rising to the desires of the unsurpassed path. Therefore, when you now arouse the mind of enlightenment, you should orally invoke the letter a. This letter is the gate of emptiness and quiescence in the path to nonproduction, and this alone is the gate that keeps defilements away.

translation: When you recite this dhāraṇī and contemplate the moon of your mind in its utmost purity, you will attain firm enlightenment.

source_sentence: 唵(一)底瑟侘(二)跋折羅(三)鉢陀摩誦此呪用觀於芲於其花上有一金剛以是相故名曰金剛蓮花當作是心即我此身與金剛花非一非異漸漸開敷光明熾盛過無量界入是金剛蓮花開敷光明三昧之時復誦是呪呪曰。
translation: Om (1) Tiṣya (2) Vajra (3) Padma Recite this dhāraṇī to contemplate the fragrance of a flower on which there is a vajra, which is called the vajra lotus flower because of its characteristics.

source_sentence: 唵(一)悉頗囉(二)跋折羅(三)鉢陀摩誦是呪觀是開花花之光明照於無量恒河沙數諸佛妙剎於是光中演暢多利菩薩清朗青聲諮屈如是方土如來入是花中是諸如來入斯花已即復徐徐縮斯妙花如舊無異隨力能觀是身大小而使住之作是斂花三昧之時應誦是呪呪曰。
translation: Om (1) Sibhāra (2) Vajra (3) Padma recites this spell, observing that the light of this blossoming flower shines in an infinite number of wonderful buddha-bhūmis, and that in this light it shines forth, and that the clear, blue voice of Dignāga Bodhisattva consults the tathāgatas of such a region and enters this flower.

source_sentence: 唵(一)僧訶囉(二)跋折囉(三)鉢陀摩(二合)誦此呪斂花隨其大小住已復入金剛蓮花之身三昧全此蓮花以成我身入是觀時復誦是呪呪曰。
translation: Om(1)siṃhara(2)vajra(3)padma(2) After reciting this spell, he recites this spell, which follows the size of the abridged flower and causes it to abide in the samādhi of the vajra-lotus body, and then he recites this spell when he completes the lotus flower to form his body.

source_sentence: 唵(一)跋折囉(二合)(二)鉢陀摩(二合)(三)恒莽(二合)句含(四)三摩庾含(五)摩訶三摩庾含觀是金剛蓮花身已即便觀于此身為於聖者觀世自在其身相者坐寶蓮花載寶花冠於其冠中有無量壽如來坐寶蓮花作說法相是名冠中如來之相左手執持金剛蓮花其執花手先作蓮花拳已然後申以中指文及頭指頭與大指相捻小指無名指如拳以茲印手執金剛花右亦然唯於花上捻一花葉作翻花勢如是觀者多利心菩薩聖者至觀所以先入斯觀為欲建立此身速獲堅固金剛之身復欲生生得如聖之身等無有異建立此身用是印呪應以二手頭指已下三指向外相叉以二頭指頭相拄如蓮花葉並申竪二大指呪曰。
translation: Om (1) vajra(2) (2) padma(2) (3) homa(2) kuṇḍa (4) samayuṇa (5) mahāsamayuṇa After observing this vajra lotus body, even after observing this body, the sage observes the world's sovereignty in its bodily appearance as he sits on a jeweled lotus flower carrying a jeweled flower crown in which the Tathāgata of Immeasurable Life sits on a jeweled lotus flower and explains the characteristics of the teaching.

source_sentence: 唵(一)訖哩(二合)薩婆迦哩(二)阿地瑟佗(二合)莎縛[牟*含](三)紇哩以是印呪印於四處四處者所謂心上眉間喉上頂上是為四處次作自灌頂法能令行者速得三身具足成就是印相者當以二手如常合掌已即蹙頭指已下四指頭相拄偃其指背作寶蓮花葉形呪曰。
translation: Om (1) khiri (2) svāgāli (2) adhistu (2) svāhva [mu*han] (3) uvari This mudrā seals the four places. The four places are referred to as the upper part of the heart, between the eyebrows, and the upper part of the throat.

source_sentence: 唵(一)地哩摩你鉢頭摩(二)阿毗詵者[牟*含]紇哩誦此呪舉其印拄於額上便散分手遶頭至頂後已尋身徐徐乃至於心住於心前復以二手為金剛拳即申頭指令直於右頭指面想有一唵字於左頭指面想一砧字即以二指相繞其指字上放以光明甚有威德復以二手繞身向後至於背上亦復從背上繞至臍上亦然復從臍上繞至於腰後復從腰後旋繞周其坐處復從下向上至于咽喉前亦然復從喉前至於頂後亦然從頂後上至於額上亦然從是額上繞至頂後如是繞已徐徐散其二手十指作是法已一切天龍人非人等皆見行者是金剛身披金剛甲諸魔邪等不敢正視退散馳走不能為害作是法次復於面前觀本法像自觀音形相如常又復如前所說妙高山觀五寶室中於其中一心諦觀無量光佛三十二相八十種好光明熾盛於佛右邊有一觀音聖者於佛左邊有一無垢行菩薩於佛前稍近右畔有聖者多利彌陀如來從紇哩字起形觀音菩薩從娑字起形無垢菩薩從皤字起形多利聖者從泈弄字起形多利菩薩右邊有一使者名為一髻是聖者乃從噎字變起於形於無垢行菩薩右邊有一毗俱胝菩薩是菩薩從於毗字而起於左邊有一馬頭菩薩是菩薩復從何字而起於形如是等形相廣如經說於佛面前有一地天是天從波字而起於形復於四方各想有神以為侍衛其東方神名曰印達囉是神女容披金剛甲手執金剛而護東方南方有神名曰焰摩是神女容只披衣甲執焰摩杖而護南方西方有神名曰皤嚧你披以甲冑亦作女容執於弓矢而護西方北方有神名曰俱毗哩容狀衣甲一依如前手中執一花棒而護北方如是神等皆有威光必使歷然想觀如對目前作是法觀已復以本明呪中呪字想在於身先以唵字想於頂上次以多字想在於額又以梨字想在於二目復以咄字想安喉上更以多字想在於二肩重以囇字想在心上再以覩字想在臍上又想唎字在於兩脾又想其莎字在二脛又想訶字想於二足之上今想此十字周布於身已然復作寶車印用迎諸聖者等所以先作前本神身觀然後方請聖者所為一一觀諸天知其相已方請慧身來就法體由是義故先觀請寶車印者當以二手平仰頭指已下三指向內相叉以二頭指側相拄以大母指向內撥其中指頭是名寶車印想是寶車而往諸尊所諸尊皆共乘此寶車而來想於是車上想有寶室眾寶莊嚴張覆寶網鈴珮周垂於其網間皆有妙摩尼寶微光皎映乘五彩色雲飛昇而往是印呪曰。
translation: After reciting this mantra, he lifted his palm and put it on his forehead, then he scattered it and passed it around his head to the back of his head, then he looked around his body and slowly reached his mind and stayed in front of his mind.

source_sentence: 唵(一)覩嚧覩嚧(二)吽
translation: "Om(1) Tulu Tulu(2) Un.

source_sentence: 誦是呪以前印想往神所已復以本部心呪及印請聖者降赴部心印者以手十指向內相叉為拳即抽出其右大母指向內招之呪曰。
translation: After reciting this dhāraṇī and making the preaching mudrā, he then invites the sage to descend upon him with this mantra and mudrā. He then makes a fist with his ten fingers facing inward, withdraws his right hand and points it inward, and invites him to recite the dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 唵(一)阿嚧力(二)莎訶
translation: (1) Aṅgulimāla (2) śahā.

source_sentence: 前以寶車印呪先往迎之次更以部心呪印請降與其俱來就行者所受供利益人天是來時復以馬頭菩薩印呪而以召之其印二手頭指已下三指向外相叉為拳二大指右押左相交以二頭指屈中節背相著即成呪曰。
translation: When the former Baochuan mudrā first goes to greet him, then he invites him to descend with a partial mudrā and come to the practitioner to receive offerings for the benefit of humans and gods.

source_sentence: 唵(一)訶耶吉唎婆(二)摩訶鉢娜摩(三)矩舍羯哩莎耶(四)施伽藍(二合)(五)薩婆鉢頭摩矩羅(六)三摩衍鉢頭摩(七)矩舍達囉(八)吽闍(入聲呼此印呪出恒僧碣羅訶經)當用是印呪召之召時以頭指招之其車臨至復用本印呪下之以左手握其右手腕以左手安頂上向前招之呪曰。
translation: Om (a) Hayagrīva (b) Mahāparinama (c) Kushyakarisāya (d) Sghārāma (e) Svabhadra Kulo (f) Samayanpadra (g) Kushyadharā (h) Unjaya (enter the sound and call out this mantra from the Hang Seng Jelāha Sutra).

source_sentence: 唵(一)薩婆薩埵南(二)噎醯噎醯(三)莎訶用是印呪以下寶車下寶車已入寶室時復以此印呪入之以二手虗中合掌令指頭相拄即交二頭指上文右押左即是呪曰。
translation: When he enters the jeweled room after descending from the jeweled chariot with this mudrā, he again enters it with this mudrā, bringing his palms together with his second hand so that his fingers are pressed against each other, i.e., he crosses his fingers to the right and presses them to the left, which is the mudrā.

source_sentence: 唵(一)阿牟伽鉢達摩波舍(二)俱嚧陀(三)阿迦哩沙耶(四)鉢囉吠舍耶(五)摩訶波輸波底(六)焰摩婆嚧拏(七)俱毗囉勃囉摩(八)唵吠沙達囉(九)鉢頭摩俱囉(十)三摩衍(十一)吽吽(十二)以是印呪請蓮花中一切諸呪天等入於寶室入已方更設座令坐坐印以二手腕相著直竪十指散開如似開蓮想即是呪曰。
translation: Om (a) amogha padma pośa (b) kuṇḍar (c) akārṣaya (d) pravasaya (e) mahāprajāpatī (f) yama-vārāṇa (g) kuṇḍaprabhāsa (h) om vaiṣadharā (i) padma kuṇḍarā (j) samādhi (k) unh (l) using this mudrā, invite all the dhāraṇīs in the lotus blossoms to enter the jeweled room, and after entering, set up a seat so that they are seated, put their two wrists together, straighten their ten fingers, and spread them out as if they were opening a lotus.

source_sentence: 唵(一)薩婆鉢囉毗瑟吒(二)菩達那耶(三)莎訶以是呪印設座已請諸天坐已當即獻其香水是水名曰遏迦水也水印者以二手頭指已下三指握大母指為拳以二頭指屈頭相拄呪曰。
translation: Om (1) Sāvabhara Viṣṇu (2) Bodhnaya (3) Śākha After setting up the seat, he invites the gods to sit there and then offers them perfume called "water of curd." The water sealer takes the second hand, puts the three fingers below the head finger, makes a fist with the big toe, and bends the two fingers to lean on each other.

source_sentence: 唵(一)薩婆烏特迦揭囉闍耶(二)莎訶以是印香水供養其水當白檀香埿等和之供養水已即作閉門印以二手虗中合掌已即屈二頭指上文左押右相叉以二大指右押左相叉各捻其頭指頭呪曰。
translation: After making the offering, he makes a sign of closing the door with his second hand, joins his palms with his hands in the middle of his head, bends his two forefingers, bends them to the left, crosses them to the right, bends his two fingers to the right, crosses them to the left, and twists the head of each finger.

source_sentence: 唵(一)鉢頭摩(二)塞怖吒槃陀(三)薩婆鉢頭摩俱囉(四)三摩衍(五)此揭藍(六)吽(七)蓇誦是呪用是印而閉於前寶室四門作是法已復作歡喜印呪法令諸聖者等皆大歡喜合二手以二頭指屈頭相拄以大指並屈入掌呪曰。
translation: Om (1) padma (2) sarva-padma kurā (3) sarva-padma kurā (4) samayan (5) this kalavi (6) un (7) folks recite this spell, use this seal to close the four doors of the former jeweled room, and after performing this ritual, make a joyful sign and spell, causing all the sages and others to rejoice greatly, close their second hands, bend their two forefingers to each other, bend their forefingers together, and put their forefingers into their palms.

source_sentence: 唵(一)沙牟佉婆捺俱摩囉(二)吠沙達囉(三)鉢頭摩徤吒耶毗舍耶(四)薩婆鉢頭摩俱囉(五)三摩衍(六)薩婆沒搸藍(七)盤陀耶(八)薩婆悉地喻彌(九)鉢羅(二合)曳車(十)鉢頭摩吠舍(十一)阿阿阿阿(十二)作是法已便作淨地結下方金剛[檎-离+土]印以中指左押右相交各以頭安頭指波間二無名指亦左押右相交以頭安小指岐間以二小指頭相拄頭指頭亦相拄二大指頭合相著呪曰。
translation: Om (1) Śamukha (2) Vaiśādhara (3) Bhadumatha (4) Bhadumatha (5) Samayan (6) Bhadrayān (7) Panthaya (8) Bhadrayān (9) Prātimokṣa (10) Bhadumavṛṣa (11) āgāra (12) After performing this ritual, he then made the vajra [go-li+tu] sign beneath the pure land with his middle finger pushed to the left and interlocked to the right, each placing his head between his head and fingers, his two ring fingers also pushed to the left and interlocked to the right, placing his head between his little fingers, leaning the heads of his two little fingers against each other, leaning the heads of his head fingers against each other, and closing the heads of his two big fingers together.

source_sentence: 唵(一)枳哩枳哩(二)跋折囉步羅(三)盤陀盤陀(四)吽(五)泮(六)莎訶以此印觸地能令下方一切毗那夜迦皆悉遠離作是法已復作結護四方印其印準前唯改竪二大指即是呪曰。
translation: Om (a) hovenia (b) vajrapura (c) pandapanda (d) un (e) pam (f) sahā This seal when touched to the ground causes all the vinatyas below to become free from them After performing this ritual, he then makes the seal of the four sides of the guard, aligning his seal with the previous one, only to change his two big fingers, which is the spell.

source_sentence: 唵(一)娑囉娑囉(二)跋折囉(二)鉢囉迦囉(四)吽(五)泮(六)莎訶誦是呪以將此印繞身三轉即成四方界是法除四方魔鄣作是法已即結上方界其印準前唯改二頭指相交以二大指頭與二頭指頭相拄呪曰。
translation: Om (a) sahas (b) vajra (b) pakra (d) un (e) paan (f) sahā recite this dhāraṇī and put this seal around your body three times to form the four directions, which is the way to remove the four directional demons.

source_sentence: 唵(一)毗悉普囉(二)捺落訖叉(三)跋折囉盤闍囉(四)吽(五)泮(六)莎訶以用此印呪結於上方界訖作是結護法已然□□秘密內外四種供養法先說內四種印第一名為鉢達摩羅寫此印相以二手頭指已下四指如常合掌而開於中復張二大指著身呪曰。
translation: Om (1) Viśeṣipulya (2) Nādrakeya (3) Vajrapāṇi (4) Un (5) Pan (6) Sahā With this dhāraṇī, the mudrā is bound to the upper realms. After making this binding, he then makes these protective precepts.

source_sentence: 唵(一)鉢達摩羅細(喜戲)囉揭那(二)摩訶羅底囉揭(三)布闍三摩曳(四)吽第二名勃地那伽摩囉(鬘)印　準前印長申引向前即是呪曰。
translation: Om (1) Padmarāsa (joyful play) rāgaṇa (2) Mahārādhiraka (3) Puṇyasamālī (4) Un (2) Bhadinagaramālī (garland) mudrā The second name is Bhadinagaramālī, which is a spell that follows the preceding mudrā and is extended and led forward.

source_sentence: 唵(一)鉢達摩摩[棣-木+(上/矢)](二)毗詵者(三)阿毗囇迦(四)布闍三摩曳(五)吽第三名為鉢達摩儗多(歌詠)印　准前印復斂當心徐徐向上開手散之即成呪曰。
translation: Om (a) padma-mātṛ [de-mu+(up/yaya)] (b) viseśan (c) abhītika (d) poja-samayi (e) un (c) the third name is padma-qita (song) seal. Following the preceding seal, he recites his mind, slowly opens his hand upward, and scatters it, which is the mantra.

source_sentence: 唵(一)鉢達摩儗帝(二)俄陀儗多(三)布闍三摩曳(四)吽第四名為鉢達摩捺[口*栗]智帝耶(儛)印　是印准前當心前以右手於左手上轉之徐徐上於頭即是呪曰。
translation: Om (a) padma-dundy (b) otta-dundy (c) poja-samayi (d) ungodly (d) ungodly (e) The fourth name is padma-na [kou*ri] jodiya (dunya). This seal is the mantra of placing the right hand on the left hand and turning it upward in front of the mind.

source_sentence: 唵(一)鉢達摩捺[口*栗]底耶(二)薩婆布闍(三)鉢羅婆[口*栗]多那(四)三摩耶(五)吽已上名為內院四種供養印法外四種者第一燒香印以二手合十指右押左相叉即徐徐向下開手即是呪曰。
translation: Om (a) padma-nikāya (b) svabhūja (c) parabhūta (d) samaya (e) unh. The above is called the four kinds of offerings in the inner court and the four kinds of offerings outside the Dharma.

source_sentence: 唵(一)鉢頭摩度波(二)布闍三摩曳(三)鉢羅訶囉捺耶(四)鉢達摩俱囉乃諦(五)摩訶揭你(六)鉢頭摩囉帝(七)吽第二花印者以二手如常合掌已即開之向上散之即是呪曰。
translation: Om (1) Padma (2) Pūrṇa Samaye (3) Prāhāraṇa (4) Padma Kulodhi (5) Mahāgata (6) Padma (7) Un The second seal of the flower is to use the second hand to close the palm as usual, then open it and scatter it upward, which is the mantra.

source_sentence: 唵(一)布瑟波布闍三摩曳(二)鉢達摩摩里你(三)摩訶室哩曳(四)鉢達摩俱囉(五)鉢囉底訶哩(六)薩婆遏他(七)娑達夜(六)吽第三燈印者以二手右押左向外相叉為拳並二大指押其拳上呪曰。
translation: Om (a) buser po poja samaye (b) padma mari you (c) mahāśrī (d) padma kulā (e) prabhāti hari (f) sabakkhita (g) satyaya (f) un The third sign of the lamp is to place the right hand over the left hand, fold it outward into a fist, and place the two large fingers over the fist.

source_sentence: 唵(一)地波布闍三摩曳(二)鉢達摩孫捺哩(三)摩訶奴底夜(四)路昬散闍那夜(五)鉢達摩娑囉莎底(六)吽第四塗香印是印相者如常合掌虗中即開其手腕以手向心散之即是呪曰。
translation: Om (1) Dibobja Samaye (2) Bhadrama Sundarī (3) Mahānudiyah (4) Luśasanjaya (5) Bhadrama Sārasati (6) Unh (4) The fourth seal of the incense banner is for those who close their palms as usual, open their wrists in the middle of a barrel, and spread them out with their hands toward their hearts, which is the mantra.

source_sentence: 唵(一)徤陀布闍三摩曳(二)摩訶鉢達摩俱羅制胝(三)俱嚧薩婆羯摩你彌(四)鉢達摩悉地(五)吽次說獻食印呪法當以二手平仰側相著即是呪曰。
translation: Om (1) Daṭabhūja Samādhi (2) Mahāpadma Krakucchanti (3) Kulosapakamātamī (4) Padmaśedi (5) Un The second dhāraṇī spell for the food offering mudrā should be performed with the second hand flat and tilted to the side, which is the mantra.

source_sentence: 唵(一)薩婆怛他揭多(二)囉娑囉娑(三)愚嚧怛羅布闍三摩曳(四)吽已上諸印名為飲食供養印呪。
translation: Om (1) Sāvatathagarbha (2) Rāṣṭrapāsa (3) Yu-rota-rāja-samādhi (4) Un The above signs are called the food-offering sign and mantra.

source_sentence: 次說印部身供養法懺悔印　以二手如常合掌已即屈二小指背相著二頭指頭相拄即是呪曰。
translation: After he joins his palms with his second hand as usual, he bends his two pinkies back against each other and puts his two head fingers against each other, which is the mantra.

source_sentence: 怛地耶(二合)他(一)阿唎[棣-木+(上/矢)]多唎(二)咄多唎(三)咄唎(四)醯[口*闌]拏夜揭羅鞞(五)囉叉囉叉[牟*含](六)薩婆耨契鞞耶(二合)(七)薩婆烏波捺囉吠鞞耶(八)莎訶是名根本印此印對佛前悔過者能滅無量重罪復作心印唯改二大指捻頭指以當心呪曰。
translation: (1) Ārya [de-mu+(up/yaya)]ṭāri (2) Duṭāri (3) Duṭāri (4) Hye [ku*yi] naya karabai (5) Rākṣa Rākṣa [mu*han] (6) Sāvajña [mu*han] (7) Sāvajña Upādhara Vibhāyā (8) Śākha This is called the fundamental seal. This seal will extinguish measureless heavy sins for those who repent before the Buddha.

source_sentence: 唵(一)薩婆訶哩陀耶(三)三菩陀耶(四)莎訶作是供養之時能除行者三業之罪。
translation: "Om (1) svāhāritraya (3) saṃbodhaya (4) svāhā when making this offering, it will remove the sins of the practitioner's three activities.

source_sentence: 次說口印法准前心印唯改二大指屈入掌中捻小指甲上即是呪曰。
translation: Next, he explains the oral mudrā, following the preceding mental mudrā, except to bend his two large fingers into his palm and twist his small fingernail upward, which is the spell.

source_sentence: 唵(一)毗婆囉始(二)伽伽那(三)莎訶此印呪力能除行者一切口過。
translation: "Om (1) vibhāraṣi (2) gagana (3) sahā The power of this dhāraṇī can remove all verbal faults from the practitioner.

source_sentence: 次說除一切蓋障印　以右手大指捻中指甲上左亦然即以右手合於左手上呪曰。
translation: He then explains the mudrā for removing all hindrances by twisting the middle fingernail of his right hand and placing it on his left hand with his right hand.

source_sentence: 唵(一)薩婆勃陀菩提薩埵耶(二)莎訶次說召一切天龍印　以左手覆之已長申五指即以右手向下叉之為拳以左手指向前招呪曰。
translation: Om (1) svabhūta-bodhisattva-yāya (2) svāhā Next, he preaches the sign for summoning all celestial dragons. After covering it with his left hand and extending his five fingers, he then uses his right hand to fold it downward into a fist and beckons his left finger forward with the spell, saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)俱嚧陀(二)婆婆弟婆南(三)莎訶誦此呪用召諸天龍八部。
translation: Om (1) Kulodhar (2) Bāvadīpaṇḍan (3) sahā Recite this dhāraṇī to summon the eight groups of celestials and dragons.

source_sentence: 次說結護一切方界辟除障印　先以二無名指左押右相叉即以右中指押於左無名指上以左大指押右小指頭次以左中指頭指及無名指握右中指為拳以右大指押左中指等上次以右頭指頭與左小指頭相拄以印右繞身揮之隨行者心遠近欲為防護皆得成就呪曰。
translation: He then puts his left middle finger on top of his left ring finger, puts his left big finger on top of his right little finger, makes a fist with his left middle finger, puts his right big finger on top of his left middle finger, puts his right middle finger on top of his left little finger, and puts his right big finger on top of his left middle finger.

source_sentence: 唵(一)薩婆藥叉囉叉婆(二)盤陀盤陀(三)莎訶次作淨五眼印　以二手虗中合掌已即屈二頭指頭相拄以大指捻之次二無名指附小指甲上呪曰。
translation: Om (1) svāharma-kṣipa-rākṣipa (2) panda-panda (3) svāhā Next, he makes the sign of the five pure eyes With his palms closed in the middle of his hands, he bends his two head fingers against each other and twists them with his big finger.

source_sentence: 唵(一)薩婆斫蒭(二)建羅羯羅耶(三)莎訶結此印者五眼常得清淨。
translation: "Om (1) svacakra (2) kiṃnakaraya (3) svāhā who makes this mudrā will always attain purity of the five eyes.

source_sentence: 次作施願印　以左手大指捻頭指頭餘三指申之右手亦然左竪右垂用前身呪作此印時能令六道有情無諸苦惱。
translation: When he makes this seal with the previous incantation, it will cause sentient beings in the six destinies to be free of suffering and distress.

source_sentence: 次作召四王印　以二手中指已下三指右押左向內相叉屈二大指於掌中以二頭指向內鉤之呪曰。
translation: Next, he makes the sign for summoning the four guardian kings. Taking the three fingers from the middle to the bottom of the two hands, he bends his right hand, pins his left to the inside, bends his two big fingers in his palm, and hooks his two fingers inward with the spell, saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)薩婆弟婆阿羯哩沙耶(二)莎訶作此印以召四王天問四天下事皆悉隨意。
translation: "Om (1) Sābhadeva ākarṣaya (2) sahā makes this sign to summon the four heavenly kings to ask about the affairs of the four worlds, all as they see fit.

source_sentence: 次作禁水印　以二手十指向內相叉已即抽竪二頭指頭相拄二小指亦然呪曰。
translation: Next, he makes the sign for prohibiting flooding by placing his ten fingers facing inward and then pulling up his two heads and fingers to lean on his two pinkies.

source_sentence: 唵(一)薩婆弟婆烏特迦(〔上〕)莎訶作此印時能令水天降伏。
translation: "Om (a) sarvâstivāda-utpanna ([above]) sahā When he makes this sign, it subdues the water gods.

source_sentence: 次作禁火印　於水印上唯改頭指小指頭相離少許呪曰。
translation: When he makes this seal, it will cause the water gods to subdue him.

source_sentence: 唵(一)阿祇那曳(二)薩婆弟婆多(三)阿祇那曳(四)莎訶次作禁風難印　先以右手中指無名指叉入左手無名指背上二頭指小指隨入押左手無名及中指心上左手頭指及小指押右手中指無名指背上出二大母指相去直竪反掌向外作此風印持一切風難皆不為害風雨神王皆歸伏隨風印呪曰。
translation: First, he takes the middle finger of his right hand, the ring finger, and the ring finger of his left hand, forks it into the back of the ring finger, and the two fingers and the little finger follow it into the left hand, and then he puts the ring finger and the little finger of his left hand into the heart of the ring finger and the middle finger of his left hand, and then he puts the two fingers of his right hand, the middle finger, the ring finger, and the back of the ring finger, and then he puts the two fingers of his right hand, the two fingers of his right hand, straight apart, and he turns his palm outward to make this seal of protection against wind.

source_sentence: 唵(一)摩耶吠(二)薩婆摩俱嚧陀(三)你縛多耶(四)莎訶次作淨戒印　以右膝著地已即如常合掌而虗其中以二頭指各附二中指背上文二大指各附二頭指下文呪曰。
translation: Om (1) Hayagrīva (2) Svāmagupta (3) Youvatāya (4) Sāhā Next, he makes the seal of purification and morality. After touching his right knee to the ground, he joins his palms as usual and salts his sandals with his two middle fingers attached to the back of each of his two middle fingers.

source_sentence: 唵(一)薩婆波囉提(二)牟訖叉褐哩陀那夜(三)莎訶結此印時能令無盡有情皆得淨戒身。
translation: "Om (1) Sapta-pārati (2) Mokṣa-kṣipa-vṛtti-nāya (3) sahā When you make this sign, it will cause an endless number of sentient beings to attain the body of pure precepts.

source_sentence: 次作禁賊印　以二手頭指中指無名指及小指友鉤左手四指二大指各散直竪作此印時一切賊難皆悉被縛不能為害呪曰。
translation: When he makes this seal, all enemies of thieves are bound and cannot be harmed.

source_sentence: 唵(一)薩婆突瑟吒(二)鉢囉突瑟吒喃(三)瞋陀耶(四)莎訶聰明印　以兩手大母指各捻二無名指甲上二小指並直竪相愽二中指側頭拄屈二頭指附二中指側第二文上指頭相去一寸許作此印當心前若有鈍根者為作此印供養所求如意頗梨王國內有一大富長者為性鈍根為七日求願即得聰明日誦千偈自餘證驗不可具論誦前根本呪。
translation: Om (a) sabbatuṣṭa (b) palaṭuṣṭa (c) angrada (d) sahā smart seal Take the two large fingers of each hand and twist the two ring finger nails, the upper two little fingers, and straighten them together to form a joint, and the two middle fingers are bent at the side, and the two head fingers are attached to the second finger on the side of the two middle fingers, and the fingers are separated by about an inch from each other.

source_sentence: 開地獄門印　以二中指無名指各屈在掌中相背二大母指頭指及小指各相去半寸許作此印時地獄門開受苦眾生一時解脫閻摩羅王歡喜讚歎觀音大悲憐慜蒼生說此法要度苦眾生亦誦根本呪生十方淨土印　以合掌當心二大母指並拄心上作此印時為一切眾生臨命終誦呪一心為作印法欲樂生何佛國隨意往生誦根本呪。
translation: Sign of Opening the Gates of Hell When this sign is made with the two middle fingers and ring finger each bent over the palm, the two big fingers, the head finger and the little finger each about half an inch apart, the gates of hell are opened and suffering sentient beings are instantly liberated.

source_sentence: 見觀音菩薩印　以二無名指及小指各反相叉右押左二中指並頭直竪頭相拄二頭指各屈第二節及第三節兩甲相背二大指押二頭指節上專心正念當現身時見已懺悔觀世音菩薩語行者言汝欲何願隨願皆滿作此法者當誦根本呪。
translation: Seal of the Bodhisattva Who Sees Avalokitêśvara Take the two ring fingers and the little finger, each reversed, and folded to the right and pinned to the left, the two middle fingers, with their heads together, straight, erect, and with their heads pinned against each other, bend the second and third joints, and place the two large fingers against each other, pinned to the joints of the two fingers, and concentrate the mind on right mindfulness.

source_sentence: 總攝印　兩手腕仰相叉右大母指壓左大母指兩手八持急把拳此印總攝一切母陀羅尼總攝印呪曰。
translation: Zongzhe ming Both wrists are upright and folded together The right great maiden finger presses against the left great maiden finger Both hands are held in an eight-handed fist This seal is a comprehensive dhāraṇī of all mothers The zongzhe mingzhouzhou zhouzhouzhou zhouzhouzhou zhouzhouzhou is said to be.

source_sentence: 唵(一)薩婆那庾多(二)母陀囉耶(三)盤陀盤陀(四)莎訶滿六度印　以兩手反合掌背相著戾腕向外以二大指當眉間向下垂作此印時起菩薩心觀一切蒼生猶如赤子一切眾生皆具足六波羅蜜所願滿足恒沙世界諸佛悉皆歡喜呪曰。
translation: When he makes this mudrā, he arouses the bodhisattva mind and observes all living beings as if they were red sons, and all sentient beings are fully endowed with the six perfections, and all the buddhas of the Tathāgata world are delighted when he fulfills their vows.

source_sentence: 怛姪他(一)薩婆菩陀耶(二)薩婆鉢唎欀(三)波羅蜜多曳(四)唵(五)訶婆訶娑(六)莎訶(七)怛姪他(八)弭哩多哩(九)莎訶神足印　先以右手中指無名指屈在掌中以大指押無名指中指甲上誦根本呪以摩兩足日馳千里作此印時地神捧七寶花臺承行者足凡夫肉眼不見但生慈悲救護之心不為名聞利養必得萬神扶助。
translation: When he makes this mudrā, the earth spirit carries a flower stand of seven jewels to the practitioner's feet, which is invisible to the naked eye of ordinary people, but produces a compassionate, caring attitude that isn't motivated by fame or profit.

source_sentence: 隨心印　以右手頭指與左手小指相去開一寸許依此印時誦根本呪所願皆得。
translation: Seal of Conformity Take the head finger of the right hand and open the little finger of the left hand an inch or so apart. When following this seal, he recites the fundamental dhāraṇī and obtains whatever he wishes.

source_sentence: 破諸天龍印　以右手捻左手背上四指向下相叉以左手四指來去呪曰。
translation: Bhaiṣajyarāja (mudrā) Take your right hand, twist the four fingers on the back of your left hand, point them downward, and cross them with the four fingers of your left hand.

source_sentence: 唵(一)俱嚧陀(二)薩婆提婆多(三)莎訶隱形入六道印　以右手大指押無名指中指甲上頭指及小指直竪左手亦然以大指從下向上入於右掌中鉤取左手中指無名指右指押左指呪曰。
translation: 唵(一)俱嚧陀(二)薩婆提婆多(三)莎訶隱形入六道印　以右手大指押無名指中指甲上頭指及小指直竪左手亦然以大指從下向上入於右掌中鉤取左手中指無名指右指押左指呪曰。

source_sentence: 唵(一)俱[口*(鯬-魚+木)]耶底(二)薩婆迦[口*梨]耶你(三)莎訶作此法印時隱形遊行自在一切興心悉皆如願多利菩薩身印　以中指已下三指內相叉竪二頭指相著並竪二大指呪曰。
translation: 唵(一)俱[口*(鯬-魚+木)]耶底(二)薩婆迦[口*梨]耶你(三)莎訶作此法印時隱形遊行自在一切興心悉皆如願多利菩薩身印　以中指已下三指內相叉竪二頭指相著並竪二大指呪曰。

source_sentence: 唵(一)多唎多唎(二)咄多唎(三)咄多唎(四)咄唎咄唎(五)莎訶若作此一切印時甚須祕密不得於不淨處及露地輕心而結若結印時當以淨衣覆上不令人見及未入三昧壇人亦不得對前結印作此印供養已方始安心念誦念誦之時當誦是呪。
translation: Om (a) Duoli Duoli (b) Duoli (c) Duoli (d) Duoli Duoli (e) Shaha When making these signs, it's important to keep them secret and not to tie them lightly in an impure place or on an exposed surface.

source_sentence: 唵(一)多唎(二)咄多唎(五)咄唎(四)莎訶若誦此呪或誦前根本呪並得觀此呪字一一從本神口出放七寶光入行者口銜行者心中月上周旋行列觀已即用蓮花子珠念誦捻珠之時應以大指及無名指相捻之。
translation: When reciting this dhāraṇī or the preceding fundamental dhāraṇī, one can observe the words of this dhāraṇī as they emanate from the spirit's mouth and emit a light of seven jewels that enters the practitioner's mouth and sends a circular procession around the moon in the practitioner's mind.

source_sentence: 念誦初摯珠誦小心呪三遍呪曰。
translation: He recites the chanting of the first communal beads and recites the careful spell three times, saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)矩嚕矩隷(二)莎訶
translation: "Om (1) Kullu Kuludhana (2) sahā.

source_sentence: 作是法念誦應隨意多少所樂念之廣發大願隨所為皆悉陳請或[舍*巨]重結前印者悉當結之若不能總結者但結前三三昧耶印亦得結此印已當誦是呪發遣天等也呪曰。
translation: After reciting this dhāraṇī, you should mindfully chant it as often as you like, generating the great vow to present all requests or [śa*jumbo] re-binding the previous mudrās, or if you are unable to conclude it, you can simply bind the previous three samaya mudrās.

source_sentence: 唵(一)訖[口*栗]覩皤薩婆薩埵遏他悉地捺多曳他奴伽揭車(二)覩舍勃陀毗沙焰(三)布那羅伽(四)摩那耶覩唵縛日囉(二合)鉢達摩目誦是呪結合蓮三昧印舉印安頭上散之如本來時法亦同相復當如前發願迴向已禮一切諸佛菩薩等散前自觀自身菩薩想令復本形心常於諸有情起救度心已然後隨意出於精舍樞要。
translation: Om (1) Kak [ku*ri] tuṣasattva, ṛṣi di nada, hinta nugga gaccha (2) tuṣabdha viṣayan (3) pūrṇa rāga (4) manaya tuṣa om vajra (2) padma mu recite this dhāraṇī to unite the lotus concentration mudrā, lift the mudrā and place it on the head, and then recite it as before.

source_sentence: 天明二年歲次壬寅仲冬三日之夜二更以靈雲藏本而寫焉且挍合之訖即彼本者寶永中南山補陀洛院義剛以如意輪寺古本而書寫之更以別本而所挍點也。
translation: On the second watch of the second year of Tianming's reign, the second watch of the third day of mid-winter in the year 2001, he used the Lingyunzang text to write and assemble the text, which was the ancient text of the Ruyilun Temple that Yigang had used to write and assemble the text.

source_sentence: 同年十二月十九日以智通譯怛嚩多利隨心陀羅尼經而挍閱之訖。
translation: On the nineteenth day of the twelfth month of the same year, he finished reading the Zhitsū Translation of the Dhāraṇī of the Tāmāndārī According to Mind.

source_sentence: 寬政十一歲次己未十月五日寫挍畢。
translation: He finished writing and reviewing it on the fifth day of the tenth month following the eleventh year of Kanzō's reign.
